text: The Bowls England National Championships (Men's Singles Two Wood) is one of the events at the annual Bowls England National Championships. The Two Wood singles is a newer variation of the game, see - Glossary of bowls terms. ==Past Winners== {|class="sortable wikitable" |- !width="30"|Year !width="110"|County !width="300"|Champion !width="110"|County !width="300"|Runner-up !width="60" class="unsortable"|Score |- |align=center|2012|| Huntingdonshire || | Tristan Morton (White Hart Warboys) || |Yorkshire || Vinnie O'Neill (Middlesbrough) ||13-12 |- |align=center|2013|| Yorkshire || Ben Render (Nafferton) || |Somerset || Louis Ridout (Illminster) || 16-12 |- |align=center|2014|| Somerset || Andrew Owens (Weston St Andrew) || Huntingdonshire || Alex Walton (White Hart Warboys) || 16-9 |- |align=center|2015|| Northamptonshire || Jamie Walker (Northampton West End) || Essex || Andrew Squire (Maldon) || 17-3 |- |align=center|2016|| Devon || Sam Tolchard (Kings) || |Hertfordshire ||Bradley Coles (Garston) ||17-2 |- |align=center|2017|| Oxfordshire || Sam Watts (Watlington) || Nottinghamshire || Aaron Brownley (Church Warsop) || 15-12 |- |align=center|2018|| Essex || Edward Morris (Essex County) || Hampshire || Peter Ward (Sports Centre Southampton) || 14-13 |- |align=center|2019|| Herefordshire || Shaun Jones (Ross-on-Wye) || Kent || Tom Bishop (Bromley) || 17-10 |- |align=center|2020|| cancelled ||due to the COVID-19 pandemic. || || || |} ==References== Category:Bowls in England
